definition: to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: Then he wanted to escape from there but tripped over a coil of rope.
sentences.chinese: 然後他想逃離那裏但被一卷繩索絆倒了。

sentences.english: You and your fantasy danced and laughed and never stumbled.
sentences.chinese: 你和你的幻想歡樂地跳舞，從沒有被絆倒過。

sentences.english: She tripped over a cordless phone.
sentences.chinese: 她被無線電話的線給絆倒在地。

sentences.english: He always appeared to be stumbling over his shoestrings .
sentences.chinese: 好像他總會被自己的鞋帶絆倒。

sentences.english: Your mum's so stupid she tripped over a cordless phone.
sentences.chinese: 你媽媽這麼笨，她的腳肯定被無繩電話絆倒過。

sentences.english: Be carefull! Don't stumble over these stones.
sentences.chinese: 小心，別讓這些碎石絆倒了。

sentences.english: The stumbling blocks are just stepping stones to success.
sentences.chinese: 絆倒你的石頭正是成功路上的塌腳石。

sentences.english: I gripped the striped strip that tripped x me over on the ship.
sentences.chinese: 我握着那條在船上將我絆倒的帶條紋的帶子。

sentences.english: Be careful you don't trip (up) on the mat.
sentences.chinese: 小心別在地席上絆倒了。

sentences.english: Her sisters tripped over her legs when they stumbled out of the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 姊姊們從浴室裏跌跌撞撞地跑出來，總被她的腿絆倒。

sentences.english: The pessimist stumbles over pebbles even on a wide and well-paved road.
sentences.chinese: 悲觀的人，即使走在平坦的大道，也會被小石子絆倒。

sentences.english: There are boulders to stumble on.
I suppose I tripped on a red sequin on the ice.
sentences.chinese: 我猜測我被冰面上的一小塊紅色裝飾片絆倒了。

definition: to be unable to move a single step
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
